item.title: Blockchain Technology and Applications
item.description: Blockchain Technology and Applications Blockchain Technology and Applications Cryptography Cryptographic hash function Application Digital commitment (digital equivalent of a sealed envelop) H(x || nonce) SHA-256 (used in bitcoin) Features Collision resistance x != y, H(x) = H(y) MD5 (proved bad) Hiding x -> H(x), H(x) !-> x Puzzle friendly H(block header) <= target Keep trying nonce, no shortcuts Difficult to solve, but easy to verify Application PoW Encryption Symmetric encryption Use the same one key Not secure to transport encryption key Asymmetric encryption (public key encryption) Use two keys (one for encryption, another for decryption) A good source of randomness (assume) Application Signature (used in bitcoin) Data Structure Hash pointer (blockchain is a linked list using hash pointers)
